item.title: FFmpeg Screen Recording - CentOS7
item.description: No Audio $ ffmpeg -framerate 30 -s 1920x1080 -f x11grab -i :0.0 -c:v libx264 -pix_fmt yuv420p ~/desktop_$(date +%Y%m%dT%H%M%S).mp4 With Audio $ ffmpeg -f alsa -ac 2 -i hw:2,0 -framerate 30 -s 1920x1080 -f x11grab -i :0.0 -c:v libx264 -pix_fmt yuv420p ~/desktop_$(date +%Y%m%dT%H%M%S).mp4 Find Audio $ aplay -l card 0: PCH [HDA Intel PCH], device 0: ALC1150 Analog [ALC1150 Analog] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 .

item.title: 2.5D Locator - ZLOC Part 2
item.description: Let’s pick up from where we left off. We have used some fancy expressions to create an image plane. item.title: Poly Image Plane - ZLOC Part 1
item.description: An Image Plane is just a “Reflection” of a camera’s Film Back. We can figure out the Image Plane’s width and height by using some simple math. Lets make a Poly Image Plane by using this formula. First, create a camera. We will be using it’s default settings.
